channel.title: Bridges on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Bridges on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: Some bridge! Second Ave Bridge, 1939 First Prize winner, Alpena MI
item.description:
In 1939, the American Institute of Steel Construction awarded its First Prize for Movable Bridges to the Second Ave. Bridge in Alpena, MI. Clifford E. Paine was the engineer, and the work was done by the R.C. Mahon Co. for the City of Alpena, MI.
2nd Ave Bridge, Alpena - ca. 1940s (UpNorth Memories Flickr)
#Alpena #nemi pic.twitter.com/NoSULy3AOi — Michigan's Past (@MichiganHist) June 10, 2014

item.title: I-5 Bridge over the Skagit River collapses in Washington State
item.description:
This is breaking news, and this blog post will be out of date. The Interstate 5 bridge over the Skagit River has collapsed near Mount Vernon, Washington. A map shows where the incident happened, about half way between Seattle and the Canadian border.
As of this writing there are no confirmed details about the cause of the bridge collapse. The Seattle Times says it may have been because an oversized truck hit the bridge with its load.

item.title: E. Stadium Bridges Dedication Ceremony is Tuesday, May 14, 2013 at 10 a.m.
item.description: Press release from the City of Ann Arbor ----- E. Stadium Bridges Dedication Ceremony is Tuesday, May 14, 10 a.m. ANN ARBOR, Mich., April 11, 2013 — A brief dedication ceremony for the City of Ann Arbor’s E. Stadium Bridges Replacement Project will be held at 10 a.m., Tuesday, May 14, 2013 near 1501 S. State Street, next to the E. Stadium Boulevard Bridge over S. State Street. Congressman John Dingell will be joined with representatives from the national Department of Transportation, as well as officials from MDOT, Washtenaw County, City of Ann Arbor, project contractors, neighbors, and the general public.

item.title: Stadium Bridges to reopen!
item.description: Ann Arbor's Stadium Bridges are reopening on Wednesday, November 14, 2012 after about a year of being closed for reconstruction, according to messages from the city. The latest information that I have is that the bridge will open at 5:00 p.m. Wednesday, but that there will be intermittent lane closures for the rest of the week to finish up the job. City engineer Mike Nearing emailed me to say that "at least one sidewalk will be open while our contractor works to clean and finish the work on the roadway and bridges.

item.title: Bridge Inspection Program Reduced Weight Postings for E. Stadium Boulevard over S. State Street File No. 2006-014.17
item.description: Thanks to Alan Pagliere for unearthing this memo, entitled "The Bridge Is Falling".  Note the date.  Alan says "read it, appreciate the dates and the content, and when you pick your jaw up off the floor, contact the City of Ann Arbor before driving confidently under or over that bridge." MEMORANDUM DATE:    February 26, 2008 TO:        Homayoon Pirooz, P.E. Manager, Project Management Unit FROM:    Michael G. Nearing, P.E.

item.title: "The Bridge at Mackinac", David Steinman
item.description: Aerial view of the roadway deck work, 1957. Photo from Mackinac Bridge Authority. In the land of Hiawatha, Where the white man gazed with awe
